pages.subdeck: Soldiers ... Afghans show their skills during a graduation ceremony
pages.headline: Two Brit soldiers killed by rogue Afghan trooper
pages.teaser: PAIR were shot and killed this morning at main Nato base in Helmand province
pages.articlebody:
TWO Brit troops were shot dead this morning when an Afghan soldier turned his weapon on them, Defence Secretary Philip Hammond confirmed today.

The uniformed gunman was blasted to death by coalition fighters shortly after killing the soldiers at the British HQ in Lashkar Gah, Helmand.

The attack was the latest in a string of assaults by Afghans on their Nato colleagues this year  raising the death toll since January to 13.

Mr Hammond told the Commons that details of the incident were still emerging and next of kin were being informed.

He said: "Our thoughts, as ever, are with their families, for whom this will be a deeply personal tragedy.

"Details of the incident are still emerging but it appears that a member of the Afghan National Army opened fire at the entrance gate to the British headquarters in Lashkar Gah city, killing the two British service personnel.

"The assailant was killed by return fire."

So-called "green on blue" attacks have become increasingly common since the burning of Korans at a US base in February.

Six American soldiers were killed in apparent revenge attacks, which also sparked riots that left dozens of Afghans dead.

US officials said the religious materials were burned by mistake.

And in 2009, five British soldiers were killed by a rogue Afghan policeman who opened fire on them in a military compound in Nad-e Ali before fleeing. The Taliban later claimed responsibility.

The two who died in this morning's attacks have not been named.

Nato said in a statement that an individual wearing an Afghan soldier's uniform turned his weapon against international troops. Coalition forces then returned fire.

Spokesman Major Jason Waggoner said: "The gunman was shot and killed."

There have been more than 45 attacks by Afghans on Nato colleagues in Afghanistan since 2007, more than 75 per cent of those in the last two years, according to Pentagon data.

It is also possible that the assailant was an insurgent who donned an Afghan army uniform to get into the base or to get closer to his targets.

Today's attack comes two weeks after a US soldier allegedly went on a pre-dawn shooting rampage in neighbouring Kandahar province, killing 17 people and wounding six.

The latest deaths bring the number of British servicemen killed in Afghanistan since 2001 to 407.

image.caption: Soldiers ... Afghans show their skills during a graduation ceremony

pages.subdeck: Cruel ... Darrell Bingham
pages.headline: Facebook abuser who targeted his own girlfriend is jailed
pages.teaser: CRUEL Darrell Bingham blackmailed his girlfriend into performing sex acts online
pages.articlebody:
A CRUEL abuser who created fake Facebook identities to blackmail his own girlfriend into performing sex acts online has been jailed for seven years.

Darrell Bingham, 49, posed as an American football player on the social networking site and subjected his partner to a twisted six-month campaign of sexual abuse.

As part of the elaborate blackmail plot, he threatened to send topless pictures of his 21-year-old girlfriend to her work colleagues if she disobeyed.

She was forced to perform sex acts on herself day and night on a webcam while Bingham carried on the pretence of being a supportive partner.

She said: "I feel betrayed and heartbroken. When I found out it was Darrell I was absolutely devastated.

"He was the only person I could turn to and that is why it makes this ordeal so hard. He tortured me for six months."

Bingham posed as "Grant" and befriended his girlfriend on Facebook. He pestered her to send him a topless picture of herself, which she foolishly did.

Still pretending to be Grant, he then threatened to send the picture to her work colleagues unless she performed sex acts on herself for his amusement.

When she confided in Bingham about the blackmail threats, he told her to "carry on" and insisted it would "soon be over".

Bingham, a former soldier, later told his girlfriend he had tracked Grant down and murdered him. He even showed her pictures of a man tied up with a gun to his head as proof.

She believed him but did not contact the police because she wanted to protect him.

Weeks later, she was again contacted through Facebook by Bingham, this time posing as a friend of Grant's called Chad.

He continued to blackmail her as Chad, claiming Grant had shared the images of her with him.

Six months after her ordeal started, Bingham's victim broke down in tears at work. Her supportive colleagues immediately called the police, who traced the online exchanges back to Bingham.

Prosecutor Joanne Kidd told Hull Crown Court: "This man is a sadist who enjoyed watching her pain, who knew she was not consenting and knew she was totally deceived as to what the reality was.

"He dangled her like a puppet on a string. He told her to 'blank it out because that's what the other girls do'."

Bingham, of Sowerby Bridge, West Yorkshire, was jailed for seven years after being convicted of causing a person to engage in sexual activity without consent.

His victim, from the East Riding, said: "I just kept hoping it would stop but it just got worse.

"From the moment I woke to when I went to bed, it was constant. I was so scared and frightened all the time I just didn't trust anybody.

"My job means everything to me and he knew that. When I found out it was Darrell I was absolutely heartbroken. It was like taking my right arm off.

"It was just a nightmare and I want him to rot in hell. I'm relieved it is all over but no sentence is long enough for what he did."

image.caption: Cruel ... Darrell Bingham

pages.subdeck: Gun victim ... Thusha Kamaleswaran
pages.headline: Gang guilty of shooting five-year-old Thusha
pages.teaser: LITTLE Thusha Kamaleswaran was left paralysed for life after attack in shop
pages.articlebody:
GANG members who left a five-year-old girl paralysed after gunning her down in a shop have been found guilty of GBH.

Nathaniel Grant, Kazeem Kolawole and Anthony McCalla were convicted by a jury at the Old Bailey in London of causing grievous bodily harm to little Thusha Kamaleswaran.

She was shot by the thugs as she played in her aunt's shop in South London in March last year.

The nightmare scenes unfolded in March last year as the trio fired blindly into the Stockwell Food and Wine store.

A bullet hit Thusha in the chest and passed through the seventh vertebra of her spine, leaving her wheelchair-bound for life.

Shopper Roshan Selvakumar was shot in the face in the attack, and has been left with bullet fragments permanently lodged in his head.

Callous Grant, Kolawole and McCalla were looking for a rival gang member when Grant mindlessly opened fire into the shop.

Jurors were told that he would have been able to see Thusha as he fired his second shot.

Dramatic CCTV footage was also shown to the jury from inside the store, where Mr Selvakumar can be seen with blood pouring from his head and Thusha lies slumped on the floor.

The three defendants were found guilty of causing grievous bodily harm with intent to Thusha, now six, and Mr Selvakumar.

They were also convicted of attempted murder of their intended victim Roshaun Bryan.

Prosecutor Edward Brown QC told jurors: "The reality of this shooting may be that, whilst there was an intention to kill the suspected rival gang member, the gunman and his accomplices couldn't have cared less if someone else was shot too."

image.caption: Gun victim ... Thusha Kamaleswaran

pages.subdeck: Accused ... Staff Sgt Robert Bales
pages.headline: Wife defends soldier accused of murdering 17
pages.teaser: WIFE of Staff Sgt Robert Bales said she struggled to believe he could be involved
pages.articlebody:
A SOLDIER accused of killing 17 Afghan civilians showed no signs of stress before he left for the country, his wife revealed.

Karilyn Bales, married to Staff Sergeant Robert Bales, spoke after her husband was charged with premeditated murder of nine children and eight adults in their homes in Kandahar.

He was also charged with six counts of attempted murder over the attacks on a man, a woman and four kids.

Karilyn said she could not believe he had played part in the horrific killing. She also

told American TV she had spoken to Bales, 38, twice over the phone but they had not touched on the accusations levelled against him.

She said: "We couldn't discuss those details.

"He seemed a bit confused, as to where he was and why he was there.

"He loves children, he's like a big kid himself. I have no idea what happened.

"He loves children, and he would not do that.

"He joined the army to protect his family, friends and country. He wanted to do his part."

Bales is accused of going rogue after wandering out of his base and carrying out the massacre.

He was formally charged on Friday and is currently being held at a military prison at Fort Leavenworth, Kansas.

Karilyn added Bales never had nightmares or showed any signs of post-traumatic stress disorder.

But he never told her about a traumatic brain injury he suffered while in Iraq until he returned home.

She said: "He shielded me from a lot of what he went through. He's a very tough guy.

"I think he'll tell me what happened, from his point of view.

"I don't think anything will really change my mind in believing that he did not do this. This is not what it appears to be."

image.caption: Accused ... Staff Sgt Robert Bales

pages.subdeck: Revelations ... David Cameron
pages.headline: The PM's party list: Details of donor dinners revealed
pages.teaser: DAVID Cameron today confirmed he dined with 'significant' Tory donors
pages.articlebody:
DAVID Cameron today confirmed he had dinner with "significant" Conservative Party donors at his flat in Downing Street on three occasions since becoming Prime Minister.

He revealed details of the meetings, and a list of names of people who attended a "thank you" dinner at No10 after the election in 2010. Guests included Anthony and Carole Bamford, Lord Sainsbury and Andrew Feldman

Mr Cameron said he will order his party to publish details of all meals with donors on a quarterly basis.

But he insisted that most of the guests were long-standing acquaintances and former Tory co-treasurer Peter Cruddas had never recommended that a donor should be invited.

Mr Cruddas was forced to resign on Saturday after the Sunday Times published secret recordings in which he told undercover reporters they could secure meetings with senior ministers by giving the party money.

Pressure had been mounting on the PM to publish details of his private meetings with donors since the "cash-for-access" story broke at the weekend.

He decided to use opening comments before a speech on dementia care in London to make a statement on the affair.

Mr Cameron said: "In the two years I have been Prime Minister, there have been three occasions on which significant donors have come to a dinner in my flat.

"In addition, there was a further post-election dinner which included donors in Downing Street itself shortly after the general election.

"We will be publishing full details of all these today. None of these dinners were fundraising dinners and none of these dinners were paid for by the taxpayer.

"I have known most of those attending for many years."

He added: "Peter Cruddas has never recommended anyone to come to dinner in my flat, nor has he been to dinner there himself.

"I already publish details of my external meetings as Prime Minister  the first Prime Minister ever to do so  and I also publish all meetings that I have with media editors and proprietors.

"From now on, the Conservative Party will publish details every quarter of any meals attended by any major donors, whether they take place at Downing Street, Chequers, or any other official residence."

He said it was publicly known that the Conservatives ran a "Leader's Group" for those who donated more than £50,000.

He also stressed that no members of the No10 policy unit had met individuals at the request of Mr Cruddas.

Mr Cameron announced that Conservative peer and senior lawyer Lord Gold will lead a party inquiry into the Cruddas affair.

And he said he was ready to impose a cap on individual political donations of £50,000.

image.caption: Revelations ... David Cameron

pages.subdeck: Shocked ... X Factor king Cowell
pages.headline: Woman accused of Cowell break-in appears in court
pages.teaser: JUDGE hears Leanne Zaloumis is charged with trespassing in the music chief's house
pages.articlebody:
A WOMAN accused of breaking into X Factor boss Simon Cowell's house has appeared in court.

Leanne Zaloumis, 29, is charged with trespassing on the music supremo's property in West London with intent to inflict grievous bodily harm.

She allegedly smashed his bathroom window before hiding in his walk-in wardrobe with a broken brick.

At West London Magistrates' Court this morning Zaloumis spoke only to confirm her name and address.

Prosecutors say music supremo Cowell, 52, had been watching television in his bedroom when he heard a loud bang coming from his bathroom.

The defendant, who appeared in the dock with unkempt hair and a baggy grey sweatshirt, is also accused of shouting at him and hurling items at his bathroom window while standing on a roof outside.

Cowell called his staff and was taken back to his bedroom during the incident at around 10.30pm on Saturday night.

Zaloumis, from Catford, South East London, was remanded in custody. She is due to appear at Isleworth Crown Court on June 12.

image.caption: Shocked ... X Factor king Cowell

video.caption: LEANNE ZALOUMIS, 29, remanded in custody charged with trespassing

article.caption: Simon Cowell finds crazed fan in his loo

pages.subdeck: Monster ... Adolf Hitler was used in commercial
pages.headline: Fury over Hitler shampoo ad
pages.teaser: ANGER from Jewish groups over the use of the hated Nazi to sell men's hair products
pages.articlebody:
AN advert using Adolf Hitler to promote a men's shampoo has caused a storm among Jewish groups.

The controverisal commercial shows the Nazi dictator  who presided over the murder of six million Jews in World War II  urging blokes to buy hair cleanser Biomen.

The message describes Biomen as a "100 per cent male shampoo", adding: "If you are not wearing a woman's dress, you should not use her shampoo either."

But the 12-second Turkish clip has sparked outrage among Jewish organisations worldwide and calls for it to be taken down immediately.

The US-based Anti-Defamation League said it was disgusting to watch.

National director Abraham H Foxman, a Holocaust survivor, said: "Using Hitler, who was responsible for the mass murder of six million Jews and millions of others in the Holocaust, to sell shampoo is a disgusting and deplorable marketing ploy.

"It is an insult to the memory of those who perished in the Holocaust, those who survived and those who fought to defeat the Nazis."

His thoughts were echoed by the Turkish Jewish Community, who said the use of the wartime German tyrant was incredibly insensitive.

A spokesman added: "It's totally unacceptable to make use of Hitler.

"He is the most striking example of cruelty and savagery."

image.caption: Monster ... Adolf Hitler was used in commercial

pages.subdeck: Shocker ... blast as balloon hits 132,000-volt power lines
pages.headline: Balloon Hell
pages.teaser: THREE teenagers were rescued last night after FIVE HOURS stuck in a hot air balloon entangled in 132,000-volt power lines
pages.articlebody:
THREE teenagers were rescued last night after FIVE HOURS stuck in a hot air balloon entangled in 132,000-volt power lines.

A stunned onlooker took dramatic pictures as the balloon was wrapped up in cables, sparking a series of small blasts.

Emergency services were called shortly after 6pm and the occupants plucked to safety just before 11pm.

Pilot Adam Griffiths, 19, from Rushden, Northants, was being followed by his father Martin in another balloon. Martin said: "It's a freak accident. It happened due to wind sheer. Adam was aiming to land in playing fields.

"Six balloons were out and no others encountered problems. I landed a couple of fields along from the incident and I heard the bang.

"I thought Adam was dead. I'm just so glad he's all right.

"I think they might have a few minor burns because there was a basket fire but it went out before the fire service got here. But it could have been much worse."

The balloon came down in a field off the A509 near Bozeat, Northants.

The occupants were rescued when it was confirmed that power had been switched off.

Insp Carl Sturman confirmed: "Three people in the balloon received minor burns. None needed hospital treatment."

Barry Newman, chairman of the Chiltern Region Balloons and Airship Club, said: "This is a case of pure accident and the cause will be investigated. It is a freak accident.

"We are just so glad that no one is hurt."

  • TERRIFIED shopper Anne Baer, 43, was treated for shock after a hot air balloon crashed in front of her in a city centre.

    It had been blown off course during a demonstration flight near Innsbruck, Austria.

    m.wilkinson@the-sun.co.uk

article.caption: I'll jump from space to Earth
Lego man launched into space
Eleven die in balloon disaster

image.caption: Shocker ... blast as balloon hits 132,000-volt power lines

pages.subdeck: Royal visit ... Duchess of Cornwall and Prince Charles in Denmark
pages.headline: Warm welcome for royals on tour of Scandinavia
pages.teaser: LEGENDARY photographer reflects on Prince Charles and Duchess of Cornwall's visit
pages.articlebody:
PRINCE Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall show no signs of flagging as they come to the end of their Scandinavian tour.

The royal couple have visited Norway, Sweden and Denmark in a trip to mark the Queen's Diamond Jubilee this year.

The Sun's royal photographer Arthur Edwards took some time to talk about the tour during a visit by Their Royal Highnesses to St. Alban's Anglican Church, in Danish capital Copenhagen.

He said: "All these visits are gruelling. It's long, hard days, flying almost every other day, and trying to keep up.

"Well if you think it's tough for us, of course it's equally tough for the royals.

"They've got to be fresh, and interested, and briefed, and know what they're talking about. It's difficult!"

But Arthur went on to tell how well the royals deal with the pressures of representing Britain abroad.

He explained: "They're so important for our country, this family. They're the best ambassadors we could ever want."

The trip has seen Prince Charles playing basketball with a Danish team, as well as sampling the Norwegian delicacy of cured moose.

And Arthur added: "The fact that the royals have taken the trouble to come to Scandinavia says a lot about their relationship with these countries, and the British relationship with these countries.

"It's going to be a great finish to this trip."

image.caption: Royal visit ... Duchess of Cornwall and Prince Charles in Denmark

video.caption: SUN'S legendary photographer talks Charles and Camilla in Scandinavia

article.caption: I'll serve this great country for years
Kate British hope  Duchess meets GB Olympic hockey team
It's the Royal blues as Queen has posh tea with Kate and Camilla
Prince Charles: One supports Burnley FC
How William and Kate saved our babies

pages.subdeck: Lonely ... Lauw Tjoan Eng
pages.headline: Disfigured by rare skin condition  but longing for first kiss
pages.teaser: LAUW Tjoan Eng refuses to go out in daylight and is scared of his own reflection
pages.articlebody:
A MAN ravaged by a rare skin condition has revealed how he longs for his first kiss  aged 51.

But Lauw Tjoan Eng  whose entire body is covered with benign tumours  will struggle to find a date because he never goes out during the day for fear of scaring people.

And Lauw refuses to look in the mirror because even he is frightened of his reflection.

Small lumps started growing on his face when he was aged just five. They now cover his whole head and body.

The condition has left him facing a lifetime alone, because he is so afraid of what people will think if they see him.

Instead, he eats and goes shopping late at night  often with his face almost completely covered.

He said: "I don't even have a picture of myself from when the lumps were only just starting to appear because I hated it so much.

"It makes me frustrated just looking in the mirror - my reflection is horrible and I try to avoid it whenever possible.

"I live on my own and my sisters live quite far away from me so I feel really lonely. I don't have a job because nobody will employ me so my sisters send me money to survive.

"When I go out during the day people always look at me strangely and I have been ridiculed by people because of the way I look.

"But they don't know me - so they can't judge me. I have no wife or children and have never been near a woman.

"So I hope one day I can be cured and find a women who I can be happy with, marry her and live a normal life like everyone else."

Lauw, from Sawah Besar in central Jakarta, Indonesia, was the first child of five siblings and was born completely healthy.

But as the years passed his condition got worse. And by the time he was 20 he had random lumps growing on numerous parts of his body.

With funding from a church he was checked by a doctor. They believed he was suffering from a hereditary disease despite neither of his parents having the condition.

He added: "It was a surprise because nobody else in my family that we knew of had this condition so to hear it was hereditary was a surprise.

"I wish I could be treated but I don't know how, all I know is that I wouldn't be able to afford it anyway.

"These days I just keep to myself and avoid people. I know this means I am unlikely to meet people but I can't help it.

"I still have hope and that is the most important thing."

image.caption: Lonely ... Lauw Tjoan Eng

pages.subdeck: Thumbs up ... James Cameron celebrates his pioneering achievement
pages.headline: James Cameron's titanic triumph
pages.teaser: MOVIE director becomes first person to make solo journey to ocean's deepest point
pages.articlebody:
MOVIE director James Cameron has become the first person to make a solo journey to the deepest point of the ocean's floor  almost seven miles below the surface.

On achieving the historic feat, Cameron tweeted: "Just arrived at the ocean's deepest pt. Hitting bottom never felt so good. Can't wait to share what I'm seeing w/ you."

The man behind hit flicks including Titanic and Avatar set off from an area about 300 miles south-west of Guam in the west Pacific.

His dive took him down to the pitch-black Mariana Trench, where temperatures are just above freezing and water pressure is crushing.

From there, he sent his first message to his support crew waiting at the surface, saying: "All systems OK."

Cameron took 156 minutes to reach the 35,800ft-deep ocean floor and just 70 minutes to return to the surface.

When he emerged from the ocean, organisers Deep Sea Challenge tweeted: "@JimCameron has surfaced! Congrats to him on his historic solo dive to the ocean's deepest point."

Arnold Schwarzenegger, who was directed by Cameron in the Terminator films, was among the first to congratulate Cameron, tweeting: "Congrats to my great friend on the deepest solo dive ever. Always a pioneer."

Cameron embarked on the solo trip in a sub he described as a "vertical torpedo," outfitted with 3D cameras and LED bulbs to capture video footage of the alien world.

He spent about three hours on the ocean floor collecting research samples for marine biology, geology and geophysics and taking still photographs and video footage of the trench.

In addition to studying deep ocean science, Cameron, 57, had been training for the physical challenges of the mission  running several miles a day, practicing yoga and preparing to deal with the sub's cramped quarters.

His doctor Joe MacInnis said: "He's like the early Mercury astronauts. He's alone in a capsule, and now he's spent enough time in that very confined crew cabin to really be comfortable."

No one has been to the depths since Jacques Piccard and Don Walsh made the descent in a 1960 expedition for the US Navy. Their stay only lasted about 20 minutes.

video.caption: JAMES Cameron is the first person to dive alone to the deepest part of the ocean

image.caption: Thumbs up ... James Cameron celebrates his pioneering achievement

pages.subdeck: Shade of pink ... the feather boa-lined shade was fitted by resident
pages.headline: Bright idea: How resident muted dazzling streetlight
pages.teaser: PROTESTOR'S novel idea to fit overly-bright streetlight with a hot pink lampshade
pages.articlebody:
A PROTESTOR has come up with a bright idea to stop a streetlight dazzling locals  by fitting it with a bright pink LAMPSHADE.

Folk living opposite the new lamp on a seafront street complained it was like having car headlights shining into their homes.

So a mystery prankster scaled the 25ft tall post and attached a huge frilly pink shade.

Val Cole, 59, who lives opposite the light in Weymouth, Dorset, said: "The lampshade is brilliant, it's a great laugh. People have been stopping and taking photographs of it.

"We used to have an uninterrupted view and now the light has spoiled that. The light comes directly into our room. It's light pollution."

Neighbour John Murphy, 53, said: "It's like a car headlight. Even from a distance it lights up our garden. It's like having a torch shone in your eyes."

Boat builder Nick Hoare, 61, who lives opposite the light, said: "I like looking out to sea at night but I can't do that anymore because the light is blinding.

"The lampshade hasn't made much difference but it is a gesture of defiance."

The man who put up the lampshade said he was a local resident but did not want to be identified.

He said: "Some friends helped me and we ensured we were very safe doing it. It's just a way of saying to the council 'turn it down please'.

"The light is aggressive and blinding. Nobody has smiled at the light bulb but they have smiled at the lampshade."

The council has erected new Victorian-style lighting columns in the Greenhill part of the seafront as part of a regeneration scheme.

Howard Legg, a spokesman for Weymouth and Portland Borough Council, said: "We're sorry if anyone has been disturbed by the light.

"When this scheme was in the planning stage the borough council tried to take into account all residents' views."

He said the local authority will look into resolving the issue.

image.caption: Shade of pink ... the feather boa-lined shade was fitted by resident

pages.subdeck: Addictive ... Brit was arrested after cops though bath salts in his flat was crystal meth, as pictured
pages.headline: Brit's two weeks in jail after cops thought bath salts were crystal meth
pages.teaser: PETER Parnell spent two weeks in South African prison while toiletries were tested
pages.articlebody:
A BRITISH man was held in a South African jail for two weeks after police mistook bath salts in his flat for crystal meth.

Peter Parnell, 34, was arrested and locked up in a crowded prison after cops searched his apartment in Cape Town and found 9.5kg of what they thought was the illegal drug.

Tests later revealed the granules  worth £900,000  were harmless bath additives and the case against Mr Parnell was dropped.

Mr Parnell had been held at notorious Pollsmoor prison, where former South African president Nelson Mandela spent part of his 27-year jail term.

Today his lawyer David Mbzwana said: "Peter has had a very tough time. The whole thing was a complete mess.

"He was held in conditions that are not fit for humans  a prison room that is meant to hold 20 men may be filled with 60.

"Peter's head was in a mess when he came out  it disturbed him deeply. It is just such a relief that no charges were brought. It was ridiculous."

Mr Mbzwana added: "He had arrived in December in South Africa. His fiancee lives here. He now is due to leave for Britain as soon as possible, and hopes to put the whole thing behind him."

Mr Parnell was given his passport back last week after he was arrested again following the case because his three-month visa had expired while he was in custody.

Mr Mbzwana said: "Immigration officials said Peter had broken the law because he was meant to leave by March 8, but at that time he was behind bars. This was not his fault."

image.caption: Addictive ... Brit was arrested after cops though bath salts in his flat was crystal meth, as pictured

pages.subdeck: Sweet treat ... chocolate can help people stay slim, a study suggests
pages.headline: Chocolate can 'help you slim'
pages.teaser: RESEARCHERS reckon eating a small amount regularly can help you lose weight
pages.articlebody:
EATING chocolate could help make you slim, a study suggests.

The research shows that adults who ate a modest amount of the sweet treat more often were thinner and had a lower body mass index than those who ate less.

They also tended to eat more and did not exercise frequently.

The University of California study using 1,000 men and women suggests that the benefits to a person's metabolism of eating chocolate could offset any fat put on by having the snack.

And research leader Professor Beatrice Golomb said: "Our findings appear to add to a body of information suggesting that the composition of calories, not just the number of them, matters for determining their ultimate impact on weight.

"In the case of chocolate, this is good news  both for those who have a regular chocolate habit, and those who may wish to start one."

image.caption: Sweet treat ... chocolate can help people stay slim, a study suggests

pages.subdeck: It's a corker and hotter than Majorca ... Bournemouth yesterday
pages.headline: Sun, sea...it's 73°
pages.teaser: THE hottest place was SCOTLAND where it hit 73° F at Fyvie Castle, near Aberdeen
pages.articlebody:
THOUSANDS of Brits took to the seaside yesterday to enjoy record-breaking heat.

But the hottest place was SCOTLAND where the mercury reached 22.8° C (73° F) at Fyvie Castle, near Aberdeen  its highest March temperature for 47 years.

Some parts of the UK also enjoyed their hottest day for 22 years  with many being warmer than Majorca. The Met Office's Rebecca Sherwin said: "It is remarkably hot in places."

But fog kept temperatures low on coasts in Kent, East Anglia and Yorkshire. London reached 14° C (57° F). It will stay warm until Thursday.

article.caption: UK temperature record broken - and it's good news for the weekend too

image.caption: It's a corker and hotter than Majorca ... Bournemouth yesterday

pages.subdeck: Game over ... retailer has struggled in recent months
pages.headline: Game collapses into administration, job cuts likely to follow
pages.teaser: STRUGGLING video game retailer likely to be slimmed down to attract buyers
pages.articlebody:
VIDEO games retailer Game has collapsed  set to trigger thousands of high street job cuts.

PricewaterhouseCoopers was confirmed as administrator to the specialist outlet chain today.

And a further announcement over mass job cuts was expected later.

Game employs nearly 6,000 staff at 609 stores in the UK, but up to half could go.

PwC is expected to keep a "core" of stores in business in the hope of finding a buyer.

Mike Jervis, joint administrator and partner at PwC, said: "The group has faced serious cashflow and profit issues over the recent past.

"It has also suffered from high fixed costs, an ambitious international roll-out and fluctuating working capital requirements.

"Despite these challenges, we believe that there is room for a specialist game retailer in the territories in which it operates."

Game's collapse is one of the biggest on the high street since Woolworths in 2008.

Last night it emerged that Royal Bank of Scotland, Game's main bank, was trying to lead a rescue attempt.

This would effectively mean taxpayers bailing Game out.

The most likely buyer is OpCapita, the private equity specialist that bought Comet for £2 earlier this year.

A source told The Sun: "Everyone is trying everything they can, but nearly 300 stores are likely to go."

Game's bosses filed a notice of intent to file for administration last week.

Store chiefs are furious the Chancellor last week waived through another Budget hike in business rates, claiming it would only up the pressure on the high street the Coalition claims it is trying to save.

image.caption: Game over ... retailer has struggled in recent months

pages.subdeck: Water lookalike ... stargazer fish, which bears strange resemblance to Homer Simpson
pages.headline: D'oh! Fish is a dead ringer for TV's Homer Simpson
pages.teaser: SAD-LOOKING fish's bulging eyes and yellow skin make it look just like cartoon joker
pages.articlebody:
THIS odd-looking fish doesn't look happy  even though he's a dead ringer for cartoon joker Homer Simpson.

The marine creature, known as a Stargazer, has the same bulging eyes and chin as the TV dad and is even slightly yellow.

Photographer Mark Webster, from Cornwall, snapped the lookalike while on a diving expedition in the Lembeh Strait, Indonesia.

And the 56-year-old snapper said he noticed the similarity to doughnut-eating Homer straight away.

He explained: "I'd asked my guide to help me find a Stargazer and eventually we succeeded.

"I was delighted and excited when we eventually found the fish as we had been hunting for several days.

"I immediately saw a resemblance to Homer Simpson with the bulging eyes and that slightly vacant look with its mouth open."

The creature was so difficult to locate because they hide underground during the day.

Mark added: "Stargazers are not uncommon in the right habitat but they are very difficult to find as they often remain totally buried and sometimes only emerge at night to hunt."

image.caption: Water lookalike ... stargazer fish, which bears strange resemblance to Homer Simpson

pages.subdeck: Ordeal ... the victims' villa
pages.headline: Thugs beat Brit OAPs in £8m Algarve villa
pages.teaser: TWO OAPs were tied up and battered by robbers in a raid on their plush Portugal home
pages.articlebody:
TWO British OAPs were tied up and battered by robbers in a raid on their £8million Portugal villa.

The millionaire couple  both in their 70s  had their hands bound with tape by two masked thugs.

The husband was then beaten over the head with a golf club  leaving him with serious injuries in hospital. His wife, thought to be named Anna, was also clubbed with a weapon.

The callous raiders escaped with cash, jewellery and other valuables in the FIFTH raid on wealthy British expats in the Algarve in the past month.

Anna said she was battered at her plush house in Vale do Lobo after the robbers demanded to know where her safe was. She said: "One of the men was shouting loudly at me to show him where I kept my money and jewellery.

"Once they'd got that then they started shouting at me to tell them where my safe was.

"I kept telling them I don't have a safe  so he hit me over the head."

The husband was taken to hospital in nearby Faro before being transferred to the San Jose Hospital in capital Lisbon where he is still recovering from severe head injuries.

The raid  on Friday night  came after a British couple were targeted in nearby Bensafrim earlier this month by three thugs armed with a rifle, a shotgun and a Taser.

Last month a Brit couple, aged 82 and 66, were terrorised by a gun gang at their home in Fonte Louzeiros.

image.caption: Ordeal ... the victims' villa

pages.subdeck: Stopped ... the schoolgirl was found behind the wheel of a Toyota Landcruiser
pages.headline: Girl, 11, drove 4x4  with drunk dad beside her
pages.teaser: COPS stop vehicle in Sydney, Australia, to find a schoolgirl in the driver's seat
pages.articlebody:
A GIRL of 11 was caught driving a 4x4  with her drunk dad beside her.

Cops stopped a two-ton Toyota Landcruiser in Sydney, Australia, to find the schoolgirl in the driver's seat yesterday.

Her 62-year-old dad, who was under the influence of alcohol, was arrested and charged with permitting an unlicensed driver to get behind the wheel.

He will appear in court on May 7.

image.caption: Stopped ... the schoolgirl was found behind the wheel of a Toyota Landcruiser

pages.subdeck: Targeted ... teaching posts
pages.headline: 4,000 crims bid to teach
pages.teaser: DEFIANT child abusers and drug dealers are applying for jobs as teachers, it is revealed
pages.articlebody:
CHILD sex beasts, drug dealers and violent thugs are among more than 4,000 criminals who tried to get jobs as TEACHERS in just one year.

The Criminal Records Bureau tipped off schools after running checks  but there is no record of how many were hired.

Last night the bureau insisted many of the 4,098 applicants for teaching posts who were red-flagged last year would have been automatically barred.

But horrified Siobhan Freegard  founder of parenting website Netmums  said: "It is shocking thousands of offenders are applying to work with children when they have convictions for child sex attacks, violence and drugs."

She added: "Parents will be appalled." More than FIFTY of the offences uncovered were sex crimes. They included four for sickening indecent assaults on children. Eight other convictions were for gross indecency, 12 for indecent exposure and 19 involved prostitution.

Violent offences totalled 830. Of the 550 drug convictions among would-be teachers, 14 were for supplying class A drugs like heroin and cocaine.

The list included 11 arson offences and two for making threats to kill.

Heads' organisation the Association of School and College Leaders insisted it was "extremely encouraging" the CRB was so vigilant.

The bureau itself said: "Checks have helped to stop at least 130,000 unsuitable people from working or volunteering with children or vulnerable people."

e.ashton@the-sun.co.uk

image.caption: Targeted ... teaching posts

pages.subdeck: Third date ... Tulisa Contostavlos
pages.headline: Tu's company
pages.teaser:
X FACTOR judge Contostavlos with Skins star
O'Connell as she prepares for legal battle
pages.articlebody:
X FACTOR judge Tulisa Contostavlos prepared for today's High Court battle over her sex tape by going out for a modest meal with her boyfriend  and his family.

Tulisa and Skins star Jack O'Connell tried to dampen rumours of a romance by taking along his mother and sister.

It was the first time Tulisa, 23, and Jack, 21, had been seen in public since a tape emerged of her performing a sex act on then-boyfriend Justin Edwards.

Lawyers for the N-Dubz singer slapped Edwards, 28, with legal papers demanding £100,000 in damages for alleged breach of privacy and confidence after the six-minute video was leaked online.

A court also banned the £3.90 film from being sold on the net. Now the High Court will be asked to extend the emergency injunction.

Wannabe rap star Edwards, who calls himself MC Ultra, denies he leaked the footage.

Tulisa admitted last week: "I am devastated, heartbroken. "When you share an intimate moment with someone that you love and trust you never imagine for one minute that footage may at any point be shared with the rest of the UK.

"This is the person, Justin Edwards aka Ultra, who is my ex-boyfriend, that has put it online, who is the other person on the tape."

X Factor boss Simon Cowell has refused to sack Tulisa when the show returns later this year. He said: "Absolutely not. No. What she was doing was not illegal."

Tulisa's visit to Egyptian-themed Little Bay in Kilburn, North London  where chicken or duck costs £7.25  ended with Jack trying to hide behind his trilby as they pulled away in her sports car.

It was their third date in as many weeks. They went to the Aura nightclub in London's West End and partied in Jack's home city of Derby.

Ten days ago he insisted he was not dating the singer. He wrote on Twitter: "Massive thankings to my MATE Tulisa for a top Wednesday and beyond. Take it easy PAL & maybe see you in USA, my MATE (not lover, not mrs)."

r.sabey@the-sun.co.uk

article.caption: Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job
Tulisa's latest sex tape

image.caption: Third date ... Tulisa Contostavlos

pages.subdeck: Fright ... Simon Cowell at his house
pages.headline: Cowell finds crazed fan in his loo
pages.teaser: SIMON sat down for Jonathan Ross Show  then found a woman armed with a BRICK
pages.articlebody:
SIMON Cowell found a woman intruder in his bathroom  armed with a BRICK.

The TV boss, 52, said it was "like something from a horror film" when he was confronted by the woman, thought to be an "over-zealous" fan, at his London home.

The Britain's Got Talent and X Factor chief was left terrified by the intruder who broke in while he was watching himself on the box.

Police rushed to his home to arrest the woman, who was armed with a brick  but a pal said last night: "She could have had a gun."

The drama happened on Saturday night, shortly after the latest BGT series went head-to-head in a ratings battle with new BBC rival The Voice.

Cowell was settling down to watch his appearance on ITV1's Jonathan Ross show when he heard a noise.

His spokesman Max Clifford said: "There was a loud bang and Simon rushed upstairs to find out what was going on.

"It came from the bathroom so he went in  and there was a woman standing there holding a brick.

"She had smashed her way in through the window and it was unclear how long she had been there or what she was doing."

Cowell's on-site security team arrived on the scene and detained the woman until police arrived to arrest her.

She was taken to a police station and is believed to have been examined by a psychiatrist, which is normal procedure in such cases.

Mr Clifford added: "It was a very frightening experience for Simon, who told me it was like something from a horror movie.

"He was just very lucky that all she had was a brick. She could have had a knife, a gun or any other weapon."

It is understood Cowell does not know the woman, and she is not believed to be one of the fans and hangers-on who gather outside his West London mansion.

Cowell is now stepping up security at his London base, where he stays when not at his other home in Los Angeles.

His London home, worth an estimated £9 million, has a hi-tech security system. It is managed by a team of staff including his housekeeper, who was present at the time.

Sources believe the woman is an "over-zealous fan"  and said the incident would upset Cowell, who is known for greeting the public.

An insider said: "Simon is one of the biggest stars in the world but he is very much a people person and doesn't walk around surrounded by big, burly bodyguards.

"He makes a point of shaking hands and speaking to people when he's going about his business. This is bound to make him more wary about being so open with strangers." It is not the first time Cowell has suffered a security scare.

He "freaked out" after finding a tracking device under his £140,000 Bentley in 2008.

Cowell became suspicious after a mysterious biker began following him. A listening bug had earlier been found in the BGT studio.

- A WOMAN of 29 was last night charged with aggravated burglary at Cowell's home, police said.

Leanne Zaloumis, of Catford, South East London, was in custody last night and is due to appear at West London Magistrates' Court today.

c.robertson@the-sun.co.uk

image.caption: Fright ... Simon Cowell at his house

pages.subdeck: Spooked ... Marvin Humes may get an extreme fright with MI5 man hired to plan stag-do
pages.headline: Spies wide shut
pages.teaser: MOST blokes prepare for a stag do by booking EasyJet flights and stocking up at the chemist
pages.articlebody:
MOST blokes prepare for a stag do by booking EasyJet flights and stocking up at the chemist.

So you have to hand it to JLS, who have hired a former spy to organise Marvin Humes' trip.

He weds The Saturdays singer Rochelle Wiseman in July but first his bandmates plan to stitch him up on his stag.

They have called in an ex-MI5 spook to help kidnap him and see he gets a more extreme fright than a few hours handcuffed to a lamppost.

Oritse Williams said: "I have met up with an ex-MI5 guy who is helping us plan Marvin's stag do.

"We are taking this thing deadly seriously and will be rehearsing it.

"It is a covert MI5 operation.

"This guy has told us he will help us get it done in the most discreet way so Marvin will have no idea what will hit him."

Forget shaved eyebrows, he'll be lucky if he comes home with any limbs left.

Oritse, plotting with Aston Merrygold and JB Gill, wants to avenge a birthday prank the band played on him last year.

They hired a buxom cougar stripper to join them on stage at London's G-A-Y venue and she made Oritse lick whipped cream from her chest.

Oritse said: "After what Marvin did to me on my birthday I am going to make sure his life is hell. It was the most shocking thing that has ever happened to me. I'm not letting it go."

The spy could also help keep the stag exploits secret from Rochelle and her uncle, ex-England and Man United hardman Paul Ince.

He will give Rochelle away at the wedding. Last year he gave Marvin a talk about looking after his niece.

Marvin won't want The Guv'nor hearing about his stag before he has to look him in the eye at the end of the aisle.

article.caption: JLS do fans Proud on opening night of tour
JLS: All for one and onesies for all

pages.subdeck: The lady in Reb ... X Factor star has flown to Oz to launch debut album
pages.headline: Rebecca looks Heavenly
pages.teaser: LIVERPOOL lass REBECCA FERGUSON should think twice before wearing this red dress for any gigs in her home city
pages.articlebody:
LIVERPOOL lass Rebecca Ferguson should think twice before wearing this red dress for any gigs in her home city.

She'd have to reveal Everton shorts underneath to keep both sets of supporters happy.

The X Factor singer flew to Australia this weekend to launch her debut album Heaven.

Rebecca's got a day off in Melbourne during the trip Down Under. She's asked fans on Twitter for suggestions on how she should spend the time.

A tour of Ramsay Street is the only option.

Rebecca Ferguson's in Heaven after EMI deal
Rebecca Ferguson is reddy to crack the US

pages.subdeck: Court with his trousers up ... Justin Edwards
pages.headline: Tulisa ex comes out of hiding for High Court date in London
pages.teaser: JUSTIN Edwards attends High Court after Tulisa sued him over leaked sex tape
pages.articlebody:
TULISA's ex-boyfriend came out of hiding to attend a hearing at the High Court in London today.

The X Factor star, 23, is suing wannabe rapper Justin Edwards, 28, for £100,000 over her sex tape.

Lawyers for Tulisa slapped Edwards with legal papers demanding damages for alleged breach of privacy and confidence, accusing him of leaking the explicit video online.

The six-minute clip features the former N-Dubz singer performing a sex act on her then-boyfriend.

The £3.90 film has been banned from being sold on the internet, and Tulisa is facing Edwards in court today in a bid to extend the emergency injunction.

Edwards  clad smartly in a suit and aviator shades  denies he was responsible for leaking the footage.

After the tape hit the web last week, Tulisa admitted: "I am devastated, heartbroken.

"When you share an intimate moment with someone that you love and trust you never imagine for one minute that footage may at any point be shared with the rest of the UK.

"This is the person, Justin Edwards aka Ultra, who is my ex-boyfriend, that has put it online, who is the other person on the tape."

Her X Factor boss Simon Cowell is backing the star, insisting her lewd filmed encounter won't cost the singer her job on the talent show.

He said: "Absolutely not. No. What she was doing was not illegal."

Edwards has been hiding out in the West Country since the controversy and has been bombarded with abusive messages on Twitter by Tulisa fans.

He wasn't at his West Hampstead, North London, home  where his mother lives  when the legal papers were served.

A source close to Edwards, who calls himself MC Ultra, told The Sun: "This latest move by Tulisa has really unnerved and unsettled him.

"It's serious stuff and he's got to take it seriously. It's a lot of pressure for him."

image.caption: Court with his trousers up ... Justin Edwards

article.caption: Tu's company
Tulisa's sex tape gag on ex-lover
Tulisa's latest sex tape
Cowell: Sex tape Tulisa hasn't blown her job

pages.subdeck: House-hunting ... Robbie Williams
pages.headline: Robbie Williams to buy Michael Jackson death house?
pages.teaser: SINGER Williams was reportedly first in line to view the abode where legend died
pages.articlebody:
ROBBIE Williams is reportedly eager to move house  to the sprawling mansion where Michael Jackson DIED.

The singer was first in line to view the now-legendary £15million property after it went on the market again on Thursday.

Website TMZ claims the Take That star pulled up outside the vast abode in Los Angeles' posh Holmby Hills neighbourhood in his Range Rover.

Sources say Robbie can afford the estate because realtors will only show the house to prospective buyers who prove they can pay the purchase price.

The Angels singer currently owns a sizeable pad in Beverly Hills, after paying £10million for it in 2008.

He also snapped up a property down the road, using the land as a football pitch.

However, Robbie is said to be keen on getting his hands on Jacko's final residence, which boasts seven bedrooms and 13 bathrooms.

The King of Pop was renting 100 North Carolwood Drive when he died there on June 25, 2009.

Attempts by his personal physician, Conrad Murray, to resuscitate him at the scene proved unsuccessful.

Last November, Murray was sentenced to four years behind bars for killing Jackson.

A jury decided he was guilty of involuntary manslaughter after giving the Thriller icon, 50, a massive dose of hospital anaesthetic propofol.

The judge told him: "The public should be protected. This is a crime that ended in the death of a human being."

article.caption: Robbie Williams runs out of puff
Buff Robbie Williams: Look, I'm not fat
Robbie Williams channels Alan Partridge
Robbie's back's no good

image.caption: House-hunting ... Robbie Williams

pages.subdeck: Wave hello boys ... Irina takes a dip
pages.headline: There's nothing thong with Irina Shayk
pages.teaser: IRINA Shayk flashes her model bum in Miami on the beach in a tiny bikini
pages.articlebody:
IT doesn't take a genius to figure out how cheeky Irina Shayk first attracted the attention of her multi-millionaire man.

Footie ace Cristiano Ronaldo's girlfriend showed off her buoyant assets while mucking around in the sea in Miami, Florida, looking hotter than ever.

The Victoria's Secret model gave onlookers an eyeful as she splashed in the water and flaunted her admirable rear in barely-there beachwear.

Sporting nothing but a tiny string animal-print thong and bikini top, she accessorised with a pair of green-tinted aviators and some disc hoop earrings.

The 26-year-old, who's been dating the Real Madrid striker for two years, looked like she was on a modelling shoot.

The 5ft 10in beauty sauntered along the sandy beach and caught the attention of plenty of staring beach-goers.

Russian-born Irina is currently having a break from the catwalk and chilling out with her equally easy-on-the-eye model pal Anne V.

The fellow 26-year-old skinny pin-up, who just celebrated her birthday, is also loved-up with a famous face  Maroon 5 singer Adam Levine.

Anne wore an eye-popping luminous green and yellow bikini with black shades.

And her washboard tummy looked toned without a single inch of fat on it.

Flaunting their endless limbs, the blonde and brunette beauties have been keeping fans happy by posting photos of themselves on Facebook and Twitter.

Victoria's Secret models? More like The Cheeky Girls.

image.caption: Wave hello boys ... Irina takes a dip
Just splashing ... Irina wades in

article.caption: Cheeky Irina Shayks her beach booty with pal
Irina Shayk's not got much Ron
Irina is flippin' lovely
Irina Shayk is golden delicious at Oscars bash
Irina Shayk rose to the occasion

pages.subdeck: Dirty ... Katie Price caked in mud during obstacle course
pages.headline: Katie Price gets filthy with her man
pages.teaser: GLAMOUR model gets down and dirty with boyfriend Leandro Penna during charity run
pages.articlebody:
FILTHY Katie Price smiles as she gets down and dirty  while taking part in a charity fitness challenge.

The former glamour model ditched the skimpy swimwear that she has recently been sporting in favour of a baggy T-shirt and some long black leggings to take part in a six-mile obstacle course.

Joined by boyfriend Leandro Penna, 26, the sporting mum-of-three also swapped her trademark heels for a pair of mucky trainers  but still managed to keep a splash of glamour with a set of orange-painted nails.

At one point Katie, 33, lost her footing and plunged into a ditch full of dirty water during yesterday's X Runner challenge in Derbyshire.

After jumping over hay bales and crawling under cargo nets, Katie finished the course covered in mud but with a smile on her face.

And she wasted no time in landing a kiss on her man's lips.

Yesterday she tweeted: "Well done everyone who ran the same wild warrior race today as me it was great fun but I'm sleepy now after roast dinner lol."

Last week, Katie finally got divorced from cage-fighter Alex Reid  more than a year after she announced their split.

Just 48 hours later, she was seen cosying up to Argentine model Leandro in a private box at a polo match.

On March 23 she confirmed rumours that the pair are back together, tweeting: "@leandro__penna and myself are happy to be making another go of it together woooooooo."

image.caption: Dirty ... Katie Price caked in mud during obstacle course

article.caption: Katie Price admits Leandro is her tweetheart
Katie Price is Mum of the Year

pages.subdeck: Tatt's enough of that ... Russell Brand sparks rumours he's getting rid of Katy Perry inking
pages.headline: Time to remove that tatt, Russell?
pages.teaser: COMIC'S late night visit to LA tattoo parlour sparks rumours he is having his Katy Perry tattoo removed
pages.articlebody:
RUSSELL Brand and new girlfriend Nikolett Barabas spent some time at a tattoo parlour at the weekend.

Arriving at the Sunset Strip venue in LA at 1am, the British comic didn't stay long enough to get an inking, but looked at some new designs in the shop.

And the late night trip to Shamrock's sparked speculation he was looking to get the Sanskrit tattoo he and ex-wife Katy Perry share removed or covered up.

Russell dressed down for the outing in a long black coat and ripped jeans with his customary hat and dark glasses.

And Hungarian model Nikolett appeared to be copying his style, getting grungy with a Rolling Stones T-shirt, jeans and matching headwear.

Although the pair have been spending plenty of time together recently, the 36-year-old will think twice about getting his and hers artworks in a hurry.

Katy and Russell had the matching messages, meaning "go with the flow" before their wedding in October 2010.

But they split in December, after 14 months.

Brunette Nikolett, 32, recently gushed about how "beautiful" and "amazing" Russell is.

During his gig at the Largo comedy club in Los Angeles, she told Life & Style magazine: "He's amazing, so funny, he's beautiful. I like being with him; he's amazing, so amazing. He's a good person."

After the show Russell was up to his old tricks, flirting with a bevy of beauties as his new love looked on.

An eyewitness said: "He was really flirty, but even in a sea of women, Nikolett just hung back and let him do his thing. He even kissed one pretty brunette quickly on the lips and told her she was gorgeous."

image.caption: Tatt's enough of that ... Russell Brand sparks rumours he's getting rid of Katy Perry inking

pages.subdeck: Swell ... Nadine Coyle
pages.headline: Something kinda boobs
pages.teaser: NADINE Coyle flashes bigger boobs at Perez Hitlon's birthday party
pages.articlebody:
NADINE Coyle's solo career may not have taken off, but it seems her chest has.

The Girls Aloud singer was spotted at Perez Hilton's 34th birthday party last night looking a lot more buoyant in the bust department.

The 26-year-old was wearing an eye-popping see-through white shirt, wet-look leather trousers, nude heels and a wide-brimmed black hat.

The chest in question was hoisted chin-wards by a black-and-white push-up patterned bra.

Usually favouring to show off her long limbs, this time she chose the less-is-more motto when it came to her top half.

She was joined by a gaggle of celebrities at the bash including recently flour-bombed Kim Kardashian, who wasn't looking her best in a body-contouring black and white dress.

The sculpting frock left her looking frumpy and over-sized, and made her appear curvier than ever.

The 31-year-old wore a black fascinator on her perfectly coiffed hair with Christian Louboutin heels.

The girls were helping celebrity blogger Perez Hilton celebrate his big day at a Mad Hatter-themed party.

The over-amorous Hilton tweeted his guest Nadine afterwards: "Thanks for coming last night, doll! Love you!!!!"

To which she replied: "A really fun party. Happy birthday honey. Till next time."

Sounds like they've got good Chemistry.

image.caption: Swell ... Nadine Coyle

article.caption: Nadine Coyle's American dream
Nadine Coyle back with ex-fiancé
Nadine Coyle's comeback 2.0
Kinky Coyle's gone off the boil
Nadine keeps it reel

pages.subdeck: Champ ... Matthew Wolfenden
pages.headline: Matt's the way for DOI Wolfenden
pages.teaser: EMMERDALE actor wins Dancing On Ice after 'most difficult bolero' ever by a contestant
pages.articlebody:
EMMERDALE star Matthew Wolfenden was last night crowned Dancing On Ice champion, edging out Hollyoaks actress Jorgie Porter.

Matthew and dance partner Nina Ulanova won the the public vote  and the praise of the judges  after their performance of the classic Torvill and Dean Bolero routine.

After his win, an overwhelmed Matthew said: "It's going to take a while for this to sink in. I just can't believe it  I'm shaking.

"I thought I'd made the biggest mistake of my career when I first stepped on the ice. I thought I'd be a laughing stock. I couldn't even stand up very well, let alone lift Nina."

Judge and former skating champ Katarina Witt said of Matthew and Nina's Bolero: "It was gentle, it was sexy. I could not imagine what a world-class skater you would have become if you had started as a boy."

Runner-up Jorgie  who also performed the Bolero with partner Matt Evers  said: "I can't think of anyone better to be up against and I'm just so happy for them."

Reflecting on her time in the competition, she added: "I thought I'd get to wear crystals every weekend and it would be a breeze."

Earlier, X Factor reject Chico DROPPED his partner Jodeyne Higgins and they were the first of the final three to be kicked out, picking up the fewest public votes.

article.caption: Matthew is fave to rain supreme
Matthew Wolfenden: Charley was a skate help
Dancers practised throwing me in air using a carpet  and dropped it!
Matthew Wolfenden is singin' in the reign

image.caption: Champ ... Matthew Wolfenden

pages.subdeck: Natural high ... Stephen Fry makes a bungee jump
pages.headline: QI Stephen is a Fry jumper down under
pages.teaser: JOKER gets the thrill of his life as he takes a leap of faith with two women in New Zealand
pages.articlebody:
STEPHEN Fry gets the thrill of his life as he makes a bungee jump with two women.

The QI host dived 141ft with two pals after a solo leap.

Fry, on a break from filming Lord of the Rings prequel the Hobbit, in Queenstown, New Zealand, later wrote: "I did it. Solo and in a sandwich. I'm officially all man."

A source said Fry, 54, was terrified before his first leap but "came back up buzzing".

image.caption: Natural high ... Stephen Fry makes a bungee jump

pages.subdeck: Role reversal ... Noel Edmonds mocked up as a Deal Or No Deal contestant
pages.headline: Noel Edmonds will PLAY Deal Or No Deal
pages.teaser: HOST set to take part in his own game show for the first time to mark the show's upcoming 2,000th episode
pages.articlebody:
NOEL Edmonds will PLAY Deal Or No Deal for the first time to mark the show's 2,000th episode.

The news comes as Channel 4 plan to broadcast a celeb version on Saturday nights with super-fans like comic Harry Hill set to take part.

Noel, mocked up as a contestant, will pick from the famous red boxes to celebrate six years on air in October.

While he plays, Xtra Factor presenter Olly Murs will take on his role as host and will liaise with the famous Banker.

A source said: "After all these years Noel is dying to have a go at playing. The 2,000th episode is the perfect time to do it."

Meanwhile, Channel 4 chiefs are planning eight celebrity editions of the show which will kick off on the Easter weekend in a bid to give them a crack at the busy Saturday night action.

Noel is filming the first one today with boy band McFly playing the game.

The show source said: "Channel 4 have been looking at the success of the celebrity version of Million Pound Drop and want to replicate that. Noel's excited as he once was king of Saturday night television."

The stars are expected to play for cash for charity, just as they do on The Million Pound Drop.

article.caption: Harry Hill's TV Burp is back

image.caption: Role reversal ... Noel Edmonds mocked up as a Deal Or No Deal contestant

pages.subdeck: New lease of life ... Trisha Goddard
pages.headline: Trisha Goddard show in US launch
pages.teaser: BRITISH TV presenter lands top job in America  after being given the all-clear following breast cancer scare
pages.articlebody:
BRITISH TV presenter Trisha Goddard has landed a top talk show job in the US  after being given the all-clear from breast cancer.

She is hosting the new show on NBC later this year and cannot believe her luck.

In an interview with Hello! magazine she said: "When I started out back in 1987, I never dreamed I would get a job as a television presenter in Australia, that I would be the first black female presenter in their history or that I would be headhunted back to England to present there.

"And then, to be here in the United States  part of me thinks the alarm clock is going to go off in a minute and I will have to wake up and do the school run."

Trisha became a household name in the UK after launching her show on ITV.

She later moved to Channel 5 and continued working despite her diagnosis with breast cancer four years ago. The show was axed in 2009.

She said: "Cancer has definitely changed me.

"I used to live everywhere but in the here and now. I live in the now these days, I really do."

The full interview is in the latest Hello! magazine, out now.

image.caption: New lease of life ... Trisha Goddard

pages.subdeck: On road to recovery ... Robin Gibb composed The Titanic Requiem while undergoing chemo
pages.headline: Robin Gibb: Writing Titanic music helped me to battle cancer
pages.teaser: HOW working on symphony marking 100 years since Titanic disaster helped Bee Gee
pages.articlebody:
IT is a maritime disaster that has always fascinated.

April 15 marks 100 years since the "unsinkable" liner RMS Titanic hit an iceberg on its maiden voyage and sank, claiming 1,517 lives.

In a series ahead of the anniversary, this week we explore stories of the Titanic.

Here pop legend Robin Gibb reveals the extraordinary personal circumstances which led to his interest in the tragedy and how it shaped his music.

HE has had a hand in writing some of pop music's most memorable hits, and has sold more than 200million records worldwide.

But it was writing a symphony about the sinking of the Titanic which helped pull Robin Gibb through a personal tragedy.

The Bee Gee has had a lifelong fascination with the ship, and to mark the 100th anniversary of the disaster he has composed his first classical work The Titanic Requiem, with son RJ, 29.

Robin says concentrating his energies on the piece helped him battle liver cancer.

He was diagnosed with the disease last year and is now recovering.

In an exclusive interview with The Sun, Robin, 62, said: "I'm truly grateful that working on The Titanic Requiem distracted me from my illness to such a degree that I truly believe it might have saved my life."

Robin's fascination with the Titanic story stems from boyhood, when he was caught up in a violent storm at sea.

He said: "One of my earliest memories goes back to when I was a little boy of seven and my grandmother told me how her mother cried floods of tears when she heard that the Titanic had sunk.

"Then, when I was eight and me and my family were sailing to Australia to start our musical career and begin a new life, we got caught in a monsoon.

"At times the waves flung the boat high, the next minute deep in a trough. The passengers were collapsing all over the deck and being sick but I wasn't.

"Then the captain made the announcement, 'Do not worry. There hasn't been a tragedy at sea since the Titanic went down in 1912'.

"It wasn't true, of course, or heartening for us passengers. But yet again, the spectre of the Titanic had been raised."

Robin, his brothers and their parents were almost killed at sea themselves when, in 1967 on the way back from Australia, their ship travelled through the Suez Canal.

He recalls: "A civil war was going on in Aden and our boat was fired upon. We were all ordered off the deck and into our cabins. It was quite exciting at the time but we could have all been killed."

That same year Robin narrowly missed losing his life again, when he and his then wife-to-be, Molly, were involved in the Hither Green rail disaster, in south London, in which 49 people died. He says: "I felt on top of the world that morning as the Bee Gees had just had a big hit with Massachusetts. Looking back, Massachusetts probably saved my life.

"Until that record hit the Top Ten I would never have been able to afford a First Class train ticket. But on that occasion, because Massachusetts was doing so well, I did.

"And like everyone else travelling First Class that day, both Molly and I had more chance of surviving the crash than those who weren't.

"But though we did survive, I saw harrowing things I've never forgotten.

"Headless bodies being dragged out of the train wreck, people screaming.

"Molly and I were rushed to hospital in Lewisham so we could be examined for injuries. I had broken glass from the train windows tangled in my hair.

"It took days to remove it but that was really the least of it. The shock and the horror was far, far worse. When we got to the hospital it looked like a war zone. All around us people were being carried in on stretchers and some of their injuries were horrific. Suddenly, it all became too much for me.

"The worst thing of all was that I was unable to help anyone, to mitigate their suffering, I couldn't cope with that.

"I knew I had to get away from all the carnage so I checked out of the hospital and instead went to stay with the Bee Gees' manager, Robert Stigwood.

"After that I suffered a delayed reaction. For days and days I couldn't stop crying. In the end the only thing which saved me was my music, composing with my brothers and singing again.

"But although I did recover, I'll never really forget the horror of the Hither Green train crash and the tragedy of all those poor souls who died or were injured in it."

Robin makes it clear that he does not think living through the rail disaster qualifies him for understanding the Titanic tragedy more than others. However, he believes it is easier for him to walk in the shoes of the doomed Titanic passengers.

As an avid collector of Titanic memorabilia, he has always been obsessed by the tragedy.

His collection includes a pen fashioned from pieces of the wreckage.

It was a present from second wife Dwina, who also gave one to RJ.

And that led him to change tack from composing pop music and, with RJ  also a talented musician  embark on composing his first classical work.

Robin adds: "It has taken us two years to complete The Titanic Requiem.

"Two years of dedication, and I'm definitely very proud of it."

RJ is also proud of the composition, and equally proud of his father's courage in working day and night on it while undergoing chemotherapy to combat his cancer.

RJ says: "He kept going on against all odds. He has been every inch a professional and he deserves a medal for it. For him to come straight out of chemotherapy and into the studio is incredible.

"We've always been close but working on a piece of music that is meant to last for hundreds of years brought us even closer.

"We composed the requiem in order to honour the memory of those who died and to celebrate the age in which they lived."

Robin adds: "I never pushed RJ to become a musician, though. I wanted him to excel at whatever he wanted to do but I never pressured him.

"As he grew older it turned out that he had a flare for melody, and like me and my brothers, who never had music lessons, he flourished. Our collaboration has been wonderful. We have already started working on our next joint classical composition, The First World War Requiem.

"But neither of us will be giving up pop music, either. RJ will be recording an album, Instant Love, and I will be working with Barry again, I'm looking forward to it.

"I just hope that The Titanic Requiem will be a fitting memorial for all those brave souls who died during the tragedy, so they will never be forgotten."

One of the most moving elements in the requiem is the song Don't Cry Alone, which Robin sings. It tells of a man who knows he is going to die begging his wife not to cry alone when he's gone.

It is a song that Dwina finds particularly emotional.

She says: "When Robin first played me the song he was in the middle of chemotherapy. I cried when I heard it. It brought up all my fears that I might lose him."

Robin jokes: "I was afraid that I might lose me, too. Luckily, I was wrong... "

  • The Titanic Requiem is released as an album tomorrow and will be performed in concert at Central Hall in London's Westminster on April 11. Tickets are available now. See robingibb.com.

pages.subdeck: No1 ... Paul Weller chats to Gordon Smart on Xfm as new album goes to No1
pages.headline: Paul Well happy
pages.teaser: PAUL WELLER's new album Sonik Kicks went straight in at No1 yesterday  just as he turned up for a chat on my Xfm show
pages.articlebody:
PAUL Weller's new album Sonik Kicks went straight in at No1 yesterday  just as he turned up for a chat on my Xfm show.

The Modfather said he is as proud getting to the top as he was 30 years ago, adding: "When I finished it six months ago, I knew we had something good."

The dad of seven asked Noel Gallagher for photo evidence he changes his son Donovan's nappies.

Paul said: "That would be a picture for your page in The Sun. I'm not having it."

The Enemy came in for a chat, with frontman Tom Clarke playing Gimme The Sign and Turn It On acoustically for the first time.

And top bloke Matt Lewis, Neville Longbottom from the Harry Potter films, popped in before the Empire Awards to talk about his new BBC1 show The Syndicate. See it tomorrow night at 9pm.

To hear the show download the podcast on iTunes for free.

pages.subdeck: Video duo ... Madonna and Quentin Tarrantino
pages.headline: Madonna has Tarantino video all worked out
pages.teaser: THE singer has asked the filmmaker to direct the video for her song Gang Bang.
pages.articlebody:
MADONNA has asked Quentin Tarantino to direct the video for her song Gang Bang.

That will be a relief to anyone thinking she might hire a more "specialist" filmmaker.

Madge, who releases new album MDNA today, said: "When I was writing the song, I was picturing one of his movies and one of the female characters.

"I have a whole thing worked out. All Quentin has to do is show up with a camera. I can't afford a director's fee."

If Quentin's wise, he'll wait until the cash starts rolling in from her world tour this summer.

Madonna: I like to work with people who talk about philosophy or quantum physics
Madge streaks
Madonna has a buff time in her new video

pages.subdeck: Golden girl ... Jennifer Lawrence is set for superstardom following her latest role
pages.headline: I was too 'fat' to be heroine
pages.teaser: JENNIFER Lawrence had to dye her hair brown and train 3 times a day to prepare for film
pages.articlebody:
IT'S the movie everyone's talking about  and could even put vampire hit Twilight in the shade.

The Hunger Games, which has just opened in the UK, took a whopping $155million (£98million) at the US box office on its opening weekend.

That was the third biggest total ever after Harry Potter And The Deathly Hallows Part 2 and The Dark Knight.

The success of The Hunger Games  a futuristic action movie based on a best-selling trilogy of novels  is set to make star Jennifer Lawrence as big a name as Twilight's Kristen Stewart.

And that is despite fans of the books saying she was "too fat, too pretty and too blonde" to play heroine Katniss Everdeen.

Jennifer, 21, said: "I didn't know until the interviewers told me that all the fans were p****d because I was blonde.

"Then I was like, 'What? Damn, I'll just dye my hair'."

The actress had to endure months of gruelling training to get in shape for the role.

She said: "It was intense. I had training about three times a day for a few months. Then, once we started working, I had to have the training just for endurance because it was so many hours.

"I mean, if there's a scene of me running up a mountain, that's what we shot all day  me running up a mountain.

"I had about six weeks of archery. It was brand new to me and I loved it. I think I'm good at shooting arrows now  and I can skin a squirrel!"

The action was so intense that the star, who is dating British actor Nicholas Hoult, 22, had a constant battle to keep weight on.

She said: "It was great to lose weight because it was unintentional. I didn't go to the gym once. It was just a really physical movie.

"I actually ate more on that movie than I ever have on any other because it was non-stop and physical and I needed energy.

"It happened very naturally with all the training. It was hard to keep weight on for continuity.

"I ate a ton. Any picture you see of me from that set, I'm probably eating."

Jennifer jumped at the chance to play the lead role.

She said: "I loved the books. That was the hardest part for me.

"I almost wished I didn't love them as much as I did because of just the pressure I put on myself to make sure it was something I could be happy about and proud of.

"Katniss is such an iconic character and there is so much pressure just coming from myself because I was a fan."

The movie, based on Suzanne Collins' novels, is set in a future North America destroyed by drought, fire, famine and war.

Each year inhabitants are forced to take part in a televised fight to the death.

Jennifer said: "I think it makes us look at humanity in kind of a real way, where it is is becoming desensitised.

"We can watch the demise of a marriage or we can watch death on television and it's entertainment.

"We're a society that's obsessed with reality. We're obsessed with gossip and bad things happening rather than good stories and good, uplifting things. We live in a world where history repeats itself and it's (the events of the movie) really not that far off, I don't think."

Jennifer is quickly rising up the ranks in Hollywood thanks to the new movie on top of past success. She was nominated for an Oscar last year for her role in thriller Winter's Bone  but she says she does not feel like a star.

She said: "The glamorous part lasts for about five minutes and it doesn't even really feel glamorous. So it just feels like a job. Being on a set is not glamorous.

"I don't really think about it because I don't really like going out that much.

"I'm kind of a home body, so I was stressing out one time about movies and that I won't be able to go out to dinner  I won't be able to go to a bar and just hang out.

"But then I'm always lying to get out of those things anyway. So now I just have an excuse  'I can't go, I'm famous'.

"I guess I feel I have to be more mature. I can't really, like, moon the paparazzi or anything, which is always my dream."

Jennifer, who auditioned for the part of Bella in Twilight, was also in X-Men: First Class last year. But she doesn't want to fall into Hollywood's traps.

She explained: "It is so strange to see in Hollywood how skinny these women are and how that puts pressure on our young girls.

"I remember being in school when I was 14 and girls were on diets and eating salads with dressing on the side. It was just weird.

"It's not healthy because I don't really think that's beautiful. Every time somebody talks about skinny, nobody ever writes how great it is to be skinny and how everyone loves someone who is skinny.

"They're always writing about when this fad is going to end. I can't wait for it to end."

Jennifer plays a former sex addict in forthcoming movie The Silver Linings Playbook, which also stars legend Robert De Niro.

She said: "Fantastic  Robert De Niro. I can't believe I can even talk to him really but he's just so down-to-earth and nice and normal."

And although she is now dating Nicholas she admits there is another British actor she has the hots for  Clive Owen.

After The Hunger Games, most red-blooded men will have the hots for Jennifer too.

Hunger Games facts



THE Hunger Games trilogy of novels has been translated into 26 languages and is on sale in 38 countries.

A whopping ten million copies of the books were sold last year alone.

Writer Suzanne Collins, 50, whose first Hunger Games book came out in 2008, is now Amazon Kindle's best-selling author. She was the first author writing material for young adults to sell more than one million Kindle ebooks.

Catching Fire  the second in the trilogy  was published in 2009 and Mockingjay came out in 2010.

Suzanne said she got the inspiration for the books after surfing channels on her TV. One programme on at the time was a reality TV show and the other was footage of the Iraq War. She said: "The two began to blur in a very unsettling way."

Now the books and the film are so successful that a doll of lead character Katniss is being released.

Thousands of fans have been travelling to North Carolina, where the movie was shot, to do Hunger Games tours. One place featured in the film is Henry River Mill Village. So many fans have turned up there, the local sheriff's department has been forced to call in private security guards to protect the locals.

a.lazzeri@ the-sun.co.uk

article.caption: Kills and thrills
Miley Cyrus goes bustier at film premiere
